body.p:
Columbia Ky
Decr 16" 1864
Gov. Bramlette
Dear Sir

At the last term of the Barren Circuit Court an Indictment for "Hog stealing" was found and returned by the Grand Jury against E K. Owsley Esq -- from My long and intimate acquaintance with Mr. O, -- his character standing as a Gentleman of irreproachable integrity -- need not assure you that I was astounded at such an accusation; I have made enquiry into the circumstances surrounding the case. and am gratified to be able to state from reliable information, that the prosecution is Malicious and unfounded -- It might be that the same felling of Malevolence that set on foot the charge Might stimulate the parties to sustain it and Mr. Owsley has thought proper to ask that the proceeding be stopped before trial and in that view of the case I cheerfully join with him in asking your Excellencys interposition in his behalf, I do this too the more willingly on account of his much esteemed relatives and family with whom I have mingled in closest ties of friendship from early boyhood. Hoping that your Excellency will favourably consider this application

I remain
very Respt
your friend & obt
servant
T T Alexander
